description: Functions and classes for working with Itasca measurement spheres

functions.name: count
functions.description: Get the number of measures. O(1) operation - very fast.

returns.description: The number of measurement objects in the model

functions.name: find
functions.description: Get the measure object with the given ID number. Returns None if no measurement with that ID exists.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID number of the measurement object to find

returns.description: Measure object with the specified ID, or None if not found

functions.name: list
functions.description: Get a measure iterator object. Returns an iterator that yields all Measure objects in the model.

returns.description: Iterator object that yields Measure instances

examples.code:
for m in itasca.measure.list():
    print(f"Measure {m.id()}: pos={m.pos()}, stress={m.stress()}")

notes: Use this to iterate over all measurement objects in the model
Iterator is efficient and does not create a list in memory

functions.name: maxid
functions.description: Get the maximum measure ID. Returns the highest ID number among all measurement objects in the model.

returns.description: The highest ID number among all measurement objects

usage_notes: Measurement spheres are used to monitor local values of stress, strain rate, porosity, and coordination number
Create measurement objects using PFC commands (e.g., 'measure create')
Access measurement data through the Measure object methods
Measurements are calculated based on particles within the sphere radius
